title: Dani Dyer denies Love Island 'showmance' as she launches new dating show with dad Danny
text:

Dani Dyer insists her Love Island fling was no showmance – and says working with her famous dad on her own programme was a “pinch me” moment.

She won the ITV sun and sex show last year after hooking up with pen salesman Jack Fincham .

But the pair split in April, leading to speculation their relationship was a swindle to make easy cash.

Dani, 23, said : “I know what I am and I would never fake a relationship.

“It was beautiful. We had a great summer. It just didn’t work out. People are in love and sometimes it doesn’t work out.

“That’s what happened with us. The British public aren’t stupid. They watched us for eight weeks. They’d suss us out.”

(Image: LEIGH KEILY)

Now Dani is trying to sniff out falsehood for her MTV show True Love or Lies – which sees couples, some ­genuine and some not, try to get their hands on a £50,000 prize.

Dani says she’d be no good on the show because she is no good at deceit.

“I wear my heart on my sleeve and I’m such a ­romantic person,” she said.

“I fall in love hard. I’d struggle to go on a show and fake a relationship. It’s harder to lie than tell the truth.”

She says she also struggled to pick out liars on True Love or Lies, leading to shocking moments.

“I tried to suss them out, looking at body contact. But I got it all wrong. I was terrible. I take people at face value.”

Presenting her first show, it’s a family affair as dad Danny, 42 – Mick Carter in EastEnders – voices the programme.

She said: “It’s such a ‘pinch me’ ­moment, having my own show. I never thought it would happen.

“It’s lovely working with my dad, ­although I didn’t see him when filming.”

Dani does ­admit to telling the odd fib to her dad and Essex stockbroker boyfriend Sammy Kimmence.

“There’s a time and a place for little white lies,” she said.

“If your partner’s not well I’m not going to turn round and say, ‘Babe, you look rough.’ I’d tell them they’d look fine.

Comparisons have been made between Dani and Love Island presenter Caroline Flack.

But Dani insists she’s not after Caroline’s Love Island job.

She said: “She does a cool walk and stuff and I do a bit of that. I didn’t want to copy her too much. I brought a bit of Dani to the show. Caroline is amazing at what she does.”

Next up for Dani is ­starring in Nativity! The Musical alongside her dad in London.

Danny has reinvented himself from a low-rent movie actor to a telly ­favourite and is fronting his first game show The Wall on BBC1.

“I’m so proud of him,” gushed Dani. “He’s smashing it.”

Following her split from Jack, six months after they won Love Island together, Dani was pictured kissing old flame Sammy, 23, outside a London pub.

Since then they’ve gone from strength to strength. She said: “It’s going really, really well, he’s a good boy.”

Talking about their relationship on the Jonathan Ross Show, her dad said of Sammy and Jack: “It’s weird, I was on here last time talking about her other geezer.

“She’s moved on. It’s all lovely. She is loved up to the eyeballs.

“This geezer seems proper. Jack seemed all right. Listen, things ­happen. She is cracking on now though. It’s all good.”

In True Love or Lies, contestants live together and take part in a series of challenges to try to work out who is faking love and who is for real.
description: EXCLUSIVE: The actress won the ITV show with pen salesman Jack Fincham but things hit the skids just months after leaving Spanish villa
